name: Bentley (Bond)
description: James Bond’s luxury car prominently featured in the novels.

content.title: Overview
content.body: The Bentley represents James Bond’s taste for elegance and performance. In the novels, Bond is associated with driving vintage and luxurious Bentley cars, symbolizing his suave and sophisticated nature.

content.title: Appearance
content.body: The specific Bentley models differ throughout Fleming’s novels, often described with classic British design, polished chrome, deep gleaming paintwork, and plush interiors that offer both style and comfort.

content.title: Function
content.body: Bond’s Bentleys function as both transportation and status symbols. They are often equipped with the latest technology and customized features suitable for a spy’s needs, combining speed, reliability, and discretion.

content.title: History
content.body: Ian Fleming owned a Bentley himself and imparted this preference to Bond, establishing a connection between the character and a British luxury automobile brand known for its craftsmanship and performance.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: The Bentley car underlines Bond’s duality as a deadly agent and a man of refined tastes. It features in key scenes for dramatic vehicle pursuits, escapes, and social occasions.
